questions.question: What did Joby say when the General asked him if he had run away or was there legitimately?

choices.answer: He said he was a run away
He said he was there legitimately
He asked the General why he wanted to know

questions.question: Explain the mood of the entire selection
What is a historical fiction?

choices.answer: A non-fiction story that has fake facts
Fiction story that has real facts

questions.question: How close were the two sides of the army?

choices.answer: they were real close, separated by the creek
they were on either side of the church

questions.question: Muted
Solemn
How did the General feel about the battle?

choices.answer: he was confident that they were going to win
he felt the soldiers had learned all they could
he felt the soldiers needed more training
he was ready to fight the battle

questions.question: Legitimately
strew
What was the purpose of the drummer boys in the army?

choices.answer: the army wanted to hear music
they told stories to the soldiers

questions.question: How was the Battle of Shiloh the "bloodiest battle"?

choices.answer: most of the soldiers went missing

questions.question: What was the General implying when he asked Joby, "Do you shave?"?

choices.answer: Joby didn't know how to shave

questions.question: How did the brass buttons help Joby to recognize the General?

choices.answer: it set him apart from the soldiers

questions.question: Explain what the General meant, "wild horses....lad out of the milk shed"

choices.answer: the soldiers should be milking cows

questions.question: What did the smell of leather (from the General) mean to Joby?

choices.answer: it was how he wanted to smell
it reminded him of a grown man (father)
it reminded him of his grandfather
it reminded him of his boss

questions.question: to be determined; umoving
The general tries to convince Joby that

choices.answer: he should return home until he is old enough to fight
he should trade his drum for a rifle to be of more use
he should try to find his family and go with them
by playing his drum he is the heart of the army

questions.question: After his talk with the general, Joby feels

choices.answer: the courage to do his part in battle
angry the general did not understand him
begging the general to let him go home

questions.question: The night before the battle Joby weeps because

choices.answer: he does not really know how to play the drum
he misses his mother and father
the army troops make fun of him
he has no way to protect himself in battle

questions.question: The setting of the selection

choices.answer: in a peach orchard, next to a church
in a cotton field, near a safe-house

questions.question: Where was name of the battle derived?

choices.answer: the union army named the battle
the church near where the battle took place
the name of the general who won the battle
